author: ETA PRIME
description:
Testing Intel’s very last NUC laptop—the Intel NUC X15—a reference design Intel made right before the NUC division shut down. I grabbed this one used on eBay as a cheaper way to get a premium-feeling gaming laptop, cleaned it up, dropped in a 2TB M.2 SSD, and then put it through benchmarks + real gameplay to see if it’s still worth buying at the end of 2025 going into 2026.
This unit is running an Intel i7-11800H (8C/16T), 32GB DDR4, and an RTX 3070 Laptop GPU (up to 125W Dynamic Boost, 8GB VRAM) with a 15.6” 2560×1440 165Hz display. Benchmarks were solid for the price—but in newer games the VRAM limit and CPU temps can show up fast, and there’s also a big downside: Intel’s NUC Laptop Control Center no longer works, which means no easy fan control on a machine that can hit thermal throttle.
